title: Neatness Counts/The Bird! The Bird!
description: While crossing the Land of Ice, Toad gets kidnapped by a Giant Birdo who thinks the Mushroom is her missing baby.

title: Day of the Orphan/King Mario of Cramalot
description: A girl called Patty arrives at Mario and Luigi's claiming to be an orphan without a family or a place to go, so the plumbers invite her in for a stay. Mario becomes the King of Cramalot in order to drive out Koopa's forces. Episode is based on The Sword in the Stone. Featured song: Bad (Michael Jackson) The Super Mario brothers are spoiling Patty, when her parents show up, ashamed that she's been taking the plumbers for granted, but they enjoy a family reunion.

title: All Steamed Up/Butch Mario & the Luigi Kid
description: With the help of the wizard Mervin, Mario pulls the Golden Plumber's Helper from the magic sink and saves the Land of Cramalot from evil King Koopa.

title: Marianne & Luigeena/Mario's Magic Carpet
description: In Marianne & Luigeena, Lyle is invited to a lunch with the Mario Bros, but their sisters are also coming, while in Mario's Magic Carpet, the sultan makes Mario, Luigi and Toad into slaves while he sells the Princess which only a magic lamp can save them.

title: Slime Busters/The Legend of Zelda: The Ringer
The Mario Monster Mash/Rolling Down the River
description: Mario and Luigi help a certain Mark Twang win a riverboat race against Koopa. Featured Song: Proud Mary (Creedence Clearwater Revival) Dr. Frankenstein asks Mario and Luigi to help him with his experiment in promising his monster a normal brain. While laying down to take a nap, Mario gets caught up in the experiment and his brain gets switched with the monster's.

title: Bonkers from Yonkers/The Great Gladiator Gig
description: When the Marios buy some magic garbanzo beans they are lead up the beanstalk to face a Giant Koopa.

title: Bats in the Basement/Mario and the Beanstalk
description: Mario and Luigi trade Princess Toadstool's cow for garbanzo beans. The beans grow into a beanstalk, leading the group to a castle in the sky owned by a giant Koopa. Episode is based on Jack and the Beanstalk. Featured song: I Heard it Through the Beanvine (a slightly altered version of I Heard It Through the Grapevine) (Marvin Gaye) A vampire (Jim Ward) arrives from Transylvania as a foreign exchange student.

title: Will the Real Elvis Please Shut Up!/Love 'Em and Leave 'Em
description: The dreaded Queen Rotunda of Rotundaland falls in love with Mario when she mistakenly drinks a love potion and tries to force him into marriage.

title: Magic's Magic/The Legend of Zelda: Cold Spells
Mama Mia Mario/The Great BMX Race
description: To save Toad's life, Mario and Luigi are tricked into a disaster-strewn Boy's Motor Cross bicycle race with three of Koopa's sneakiest minions.

title: Alligator Dundee/Stars in Their Eyes
description: Long John Koopa kidnaps the Princess and is auctioning her off to his fellow pirates when our heroes arrive in pirate disguises.

title: Dance/Jungle Fever
description: Koopa forces the brilliant scientist Dr. Nerdnick to turn him into a half-robot, half-Koopa monster.

title: Cher's Poochie/Brooklyn Bound
description: Our heroes are lured into a spooky castle in the Land of Turtlevania where Count Koopula plans to turn the Princess into a spaghetti-sauce-sucking vampire.

title: Wild Thing/The Legend of Zelda: The White Knight
description: Mario, Luigi, The Princess, and Toad hack their way through the Ama-Zone Jungle searching for Sheldon the Witch Doctor, but Koopa gets to him first.

title: E.C. the Extra Creepy/Toad Warriors
description: Koopa has moved his underhandedness under the sea, has captured King Neptune, and is forcing the Mermushrooms to loot the sunken ships of gold coins.

title: The Marios Fight Back/The Fire of Hercufleas
description: The Marios seek the help of the legendary hero Hercufleas, but find it's the hero himself who needs help to recover the "Great Balls of Fire" stolen by King Koopa.

title: Magician/Count Koopula
description: Mario's group enter a castle in Turtlevania, where Koopa and his minions are all monsters. Episode is based on Count Dracula. Featured song: Thriller (Michael Jackson) Magician Harry Blackstone Jr. visits Luigi.

title: Do You Believe in Magic/Pirates of Koopa
description: Our heroes arrive for the wedding of Romero and Joliet, only to find Koopa has reignited the feud between the two lovers' families.

title: Mommies Curse/The Legend of Zelda: Kiss 'N Tell
Lost Dog/Two Plumbers and a Baby
description: The Marios finally find a way back to Brooklyn -- and are faced with a big decision when Koopa captures the Princess just at the moment they can return home .

title: Plumbers of the Year/The Adventures of Sherlock Mario
description: When Professor Koopa-arity kidnaps the brilliant criminologist Herlock Sholmes, the Marios turn detective.

title: Mario Hillbillies/Do You Princess Toadstool Take This Koopa...?
description: Koopa threatens to turn the Marios into rocks unless Princess Toadstool agrees to marry him.

title: Super Plant/The Pied Koopa
description: King Koopa steals every drop of spaghetti sauce in Car Land, but our heroes come to the rescue of the Mushroom Colonists when Toad turns super and saves the day.

title: Fred Van Winkle/The Legend of Zelda: Sing for the Unicorn
Baby Mario Love/Koopenstein
description: Dr. Koopenstein starts the trouble by trying to steal the Marios' brains for his new invention, and then he really turns into a monster.

title: 9001: A Mario Odyssey/On Her Majesty's Sewer Service
description: When Princess Toadstool's chief spy (James Blond) is zapped by Koopa, Mario and Luigi turn secret agent.

title: Fake Bro/Mario and Joliet
description: Romano and Joliet are unable to get married due to the feud going on between their fathers, which Koopa secretly started. Episode is based on Romeo and Juliet. Featured song: That's Amore (Dean Martin) A schemer (Vic Dunlop) in order to get rich quick pretends to be Mario and Luigi's missing brother.

title: Time Out Luigi/Too Hot to Handle
description: Koopa and Fryguy use a fake volcano god to trick a tribe of islanders into sacrificing Princess. Featured song: Hot Hot Hot (Buster Poindexter) Luigi buys a watch that runs backwards from a mysterious salesperson. Soon, he does everything backwards, even eating.

roles.char: Angelica-Mysterious Salesperson for Weird and Spooky Gadgets Incorporated

title: Tutti Frutti, Oh Mario/The Legend of Zelda: That Sinking Feeling
description: Our heroes return to the oriental city of Sayonara where they combat Karate Koopa and his Ninja Ninjiis with the martial art of Plumb-Fu.

title: Flower Power/Hooded Robin and His Mario Men
description: The Marios arrive in Sharewood Forest and help the Hooded Robin recover the gold coins that the rich Sheriff of Koopingham has stolen from the poor.

title: Vampire Until Ready/20,000 Koopas Under the Sea
description: Our heroes travel to Oceanworld where they discover Captain Koopa-Nemo is using a super submarine to terrorize the Mushroom People.

title: Heart Throb/Mighty McMario and the Pot of Gold
description: When a Leprechaun our heroes meet in Shamrock Land asks them to help recover his Pot O'Gold Coins stolen by Koopa, the Marios can only say "yes".

title: Fortune Teller/Mario Meets Koop-zilla
description: After eating Super Sushi, Koopa has grown enormous, and is terrorizing the city of Sayonara. Episode is based on Godzilla. Featured song: The Jolly Green Giant (The Kingsmen) Mario and Luigi, anxious to find out what prize they won in a sweepstakes, consult a fortune teller (Kay Ballard) for help.

title: The Magic Love/The Legend of Zelda: Doppelganger
Little Marios/Koopa Klaus
description: When the evil Koopa Claus (Bah Humkoop!) tries to stop Christmas, the Marios come to Santa's rescue and Toad learns the true spirit of giving.

title: Gorilla My Dreams/Mario and the Red Baron Koopa
description: When Koopa teams up with the dreaded sky turtle Lakatu, our heroes head for an aerial dogfight in their flying carpet biplane.

title: George Washington Slept Here/The Unzappables
description: Mario and his friends travel to Mobsterland where they discover the city is being terrorized by the notorious gangster Al Koopone.

title: Caught in a Draft/Bad Rap
description: Koopa kidnaps the King of Rapland where everyone speaks in rap rhyme and it's up to the rapping Marios to save the day.

title: Defective Gadgetry/The Legend of Zelda: Underworld Connections
Toupee/The Mark of Zero
description: Mario and Luigi come to El Desertland's rescue against the evil Capitan El Koopa by donning black masks and capes to become the legendary heros "Zero" and "Zero Plus One".

title: The Artist/The Ten Koopmandments
description: Our heroes travel to Desertland where they discover Koop-Tut has enslaved the Desertlanders and is enforcing an evil set of rules known as the Ten Koopmandments.

title: Zenned Out Mario/The Koopas Are Coming! The Koopas Are Coming!
description: Our heroes come to the rescue of General George Washingtoad by helping him cross the Delawide River to defeat the Redcoat Koopa's army.

title: Texas Tea/The Trojan Koopa
description: When King Koopa holds the Princess captive in his impregnable island fortress, the Marios get inside by hiding in a wooden "Trojan Koopa."

title: The Great Hereafter/The Legend of Zelda: Stinging a Stinger

roles.char: The Old Psychic Lady with the Evil Eye Who Reads Fortunes and Knows Everything Before It Happens

title: The Painting/Quest for Pizza
description: When Caveman Alley Koopa poisons Mario, his three friends have to find a way to make pre-historic pizza to save his life .

title: Game Show Host/The Great Gold Coin Rush
description: The Marios discover the Mother Lode of Gold Coins, but -- Klaimjump Koopa rides in and takes over.

title: Home Radio/Elvin Lives
description: The Marios, the Princess, and Toad arrive in Sock Hop Land to save the music king Elvin Parsley from Greaser Koopa.

title: Glasnuts/Plummers Academy
description: In a flashback to their days of Basic Draining at the Brooklyn Academy of Plumbing, Mario and Luigi tell of their troubles with Drain Sergeant Kooperman and why the President of the United States called them to the White House.

title: Treasure of the Sierra Brooklyn/The Legend of Zelda: Hitch in the Works
Adee Don't/Karate Koopa
description: When Koopa kidnaps Princess Toadstool and Toad, Mario and Luigi turn to a karate master for help. Featured song: Kung Fu Fighting (Carl Douglas)

title: Chippie Chipmunks/Mario of the Apes
description: Mario loses his memory in the middle of the jungle and is adopted by two apes who rename him Marzan.

title: A Basement Divided/Princess, I Shrunk the Mario Brothers
description: When Toad accidentally spills a shrinking potion on the Marios they must overcome the perils of giant Troopas, drain pipes filled with monster-sized bugs, and Koopa's big feet.

title: No Way to Treat a Queenie/Little Red Riding Princess
description: Our heroes have come to Winterland so the Princess can visit her grandmother, but Koopa sees her crossing the forest all alone and plays big bad wolf.

title: Pizza Crush/The Legend of Zelda: Fairies in the Spring
Goodbye Mr. Fish/The Provolone Ranger
description: Mario teams up with a friendly mushroom Indian named Pronto to rescue his friends from Billy The Koopa in the Wild West.

title: French/Escape from Koopatraz
description: The Marios, the Princess, and Toad are captured by Koopa and sent to his island dungeon Koopatraz where they engineer a daring escape.

title: Two Bums from Brooklyn/Mario of the Deep
description: Mario's group tries to save Aqualand from Koopa's reign. Baseball manager Tummy Lasagna (a parody of Tommy Lasorda, played by Joe Bellan) arrives to sample Mario's meatballs for his restaurant and hires the Marios to sell peanuts at the ballpark.

title: Opera/Flatbush Koopa
description: The Marios return to Brooklyn to find that Koopa has taken over and renamed the City Kooplyn.

title: Tutti Frutti Mario/The Legend of Zelda: The Missing Link
Cyrano de Mario/Raiders of the Lost Mushroom
description: Indiana Mario and his friends travel to Jungleland in search of a legendary golden statuette -- "The Lost Mushroom."

title: Rowdy Roddy's Rotten Pipes/Crocodile Mario
description: Our heroes arrive in Down Under Land and have to save the Outback Mushroom People from Kangaroo Koopa and an army of crocodiles.

title: Santa Claus Is Coming to Flatbush/Star Koopa
description: Our heroes are chased through space by Darth Koopa and thrown into the Intergalactic Insinkerator.

title: Captain Lou Is Missing/Robo Koopa
description: While the Mario Brothers are enjoying their pizza, Cyndi Lauper comes inside and is looking for Lou Albano since he is missing, she and the Mario Bros form a search party to look for him.

title: The Ghoul of My Dreams/The Legend of Zelda: The Moblins Are Revolting
